quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Lyra and The Amber Spyglass
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, guardians, death. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who are Lyra and Wills new guardians in The Amber Spyglass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chevalier Tialys and Lady Salmakia

questions.question: How do Lyra and Will bring an end to death in The Amber Spyglass?

options.text: They open a door to a new world for the dead to escape.
They discover the fountain of everlasting life.
They seal the doorway to the land of the dead forever.
They destroy the boatsmen to the land of the dead.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They open a door to a new world for the dead to escape.

questions.question: Who does Lyra inadvertently destroy in The Amber Spyglass when trying to help him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Authority

questions.question: What is the price the dead must pay for the Harpys guidance in The Amber Spyglass?

options.text: Two silver pieces; one for each eye

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True stories of their life

questions.question: Do Lyra and Will end up together at the end of The Amber Spyglass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: What/who helps Lyra and Will get onto the boat of the dead in The Amber Spyglass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Her death

questions.question: What role will Dr. Malone play in Lyras destiny, in The Amber Spyglass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Serpent

questions.question: What final form does Pantalaimon take at the end of The Amber Spyglass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A pine marten

questions.question: Which character of the book The Amber Spyglass sacrifices his/her life to save Lyra?

options.text: Both Lord Asriel and Mrs. Coulter

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both Lord Asriel and Mrs. Coulter

questions.question: Which character of the novel The Amber Spyglass calls Lyra to the Land of the Dead?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger

questions.question: How does Dr. Malone tempt Lyra in The Amber Spyglass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: With Stories of Love

questions.question: Who are Dr. Malones new friends in The Amber Spyglass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mulefa

questions.question: In the novel The Amber Spyglass, Father Gomez was sent by the Consistorial Court to guide Lyra to Dr. Malone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: As the novel Nicolae ends, which 2 members of the Tribulation Force are unaccounted for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chloe and Amanda

questions.question: How does Lyra betray Pantalaimon in the book The Amber Spyglass?

options.text: She gives him to Mrs. Coulter to fight Lord Asriel.
She travels to the land of the dead without him.
She gives him to Lord Asriel to fight Metatron.
She has him severed from her.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She travels to the land of the dead without him.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Inkspell and Tailor
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, phrase, mothers. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who is the author of the novel Inkspell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cornelia Funke

questions.question: What does the phrase Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy refer to in the novel of the same name?

options.text: code names for the British Intelligence Officers suspected of being the traitor
a pass phrase used to identify friendly agents.
an encryption key used to decipher intelligence material
names of safe-houses used by the British Secret Service.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: code names for the British Intelligence Officers suspected of being the traitor

questions.question: What is Meggies mothers name in the book Inkspell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Resa

questions.question: What is the name of the famous tight rope walker described in the novel Inkspell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cloud-Dancer

questions.question: What does Inkspell character Dustfinger call Meggies father?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Silvertongue

questions.question: What is wrong with Meggies mother in the novel Inkspell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She became mute.

questions.question: In the novel Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy, what was the name of the Operation launched by the former Head of the British Secret Service in a desperate attempt to root out the traitor in the Service?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Testify

questions.question: What was the code name of the former head of the British Secret Service, who died of a heart attack a year prior to the events outlined in the book Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Control

questions.question: Is it true that in the novel Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy, the name of the Soviet spymaster running the Mole is Karlov?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: What does Farid secretly call Orpheus in the book Inkspell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cheeseface

questions.question: What is Capricorns mothers name in the book Inkspell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mortola

questions.question: Central to the plot of the novel Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy is the fact that the New Head of the Service, Percy Alleline has come across a source supplying Soviet Intelligence. The name of the Intelligence supplied is codenamed Witchcraft, but what is the codename of the source supplying it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Merlin

questions.question: Jules Verne is often referred to as the Father of Science Fiction, along with what other author?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: H.G. Wells

questions.question: In the book Inkspell, whose house do Meggie and her parents live in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elinors house

questions.question: In the novel Inkspell, what animal always goes around with the black prince?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A bear

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Jules Verne and Eliot
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, ship, haigh-wood. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: T. S. Eliot was the last of 6 children surviving. How old were his parents when he was born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 44

questions.question: What was the reason for Jules Vernes permanent limp with his left leg?

options.text: He tripped in his cat and broke his leg.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was shot.

questions.question: What novel by Jules Verne was used as a base for a 2008 3-D science fiction movie directed by Eric Brevig?

options.text: From the Earth to the Moon
Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea
Journey to the Center of the Earth

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Journey to the Center of the Earth

questions.question: This novel by Jules Verne, often called his lost novel, was written in 1863 and published for the first time in 1994. It tells the story of a young man who lives in a highly technologically advanced world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paris in the 20th Century

questions.question: T. S. Eliots father, who came from a prominent New England family, was on the Board of Directors of Washington University. He was also a Chairman at Hydraulic-Press Brick Company in St. Louis, a successful business man and a chemist. He married Eliots mother in 1868. What was her occupation?

options.text: A poet and a social worker
A music teacher at Washington University

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A poet and a social worker

questions.question: T. S. Eliot attended this prestigious Ivy League college, editing its literary magazine with Pulitzer- winning poet Conrad Aiken.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvard

questions.question: When he was twelve, Jules Verne crept onto a ship that was bound for India, and was caught and whipped by his father. What famous phrase did Jules Verne say after that?

options.text: This shall not stop me, for it is pain that makes man grow stronger.
You shall be sorry for this one day, father.
I shall from now on only travel in my imagination.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I shall from now on only travel in my imagination.

questions.question: Which of these inventions did Jules Verne predict in his novels written in the 19th century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Jules Vernes publisher, Pierre-Jules Hetzel suggested that Verne make what kind of major changes in all of his works?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Introducing a more optimistic tone

questions.question: What do the initials T. S. stand for in the name of the famous poet T. S. Eliot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Stearns

questions.question: What did Jules Verne study in Paris after completing his studies at the Lyceum?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Law

questions.question: What language did Jules Verne study at the boarding school at the Saint Donatien College, where he was sent at the age of nine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Latin

questions.question: With what great French writer did Jules Verne establish a close friendship?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexandre Dumas, Sr.

questions.question: In April 1915, T. S. Eliot met  Vivienne Haigh-Wood, a governess in Cambridge. They were married on 26 June 1915. Where were they married?

options.text: At the Eliot family church outside of Boston
At Eliots family home in St. Louis

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In a local register office

questions.question: While a doctoral student, T. S. Eliot studied Buddhism and Indic philology, learning Sanskrit and Pāli to read the religious texts. What languages did Eliot study/learn in prep school and college?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Latin, Greek, French, and German

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Franken and Eliot
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, iraq, college. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: First published in 1915, this poem by T. S. Eliot portrays upper class society as quite empty and lonely. Its epigraph is from Marlowes The Jew of Malta-

options.text: The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Portrait of a Lady

questions.question: Al Franken is critical of this veteran news journalist, famous as managing editor of the Fox News Channel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brit Hume

questions.question: Why did Al Franken choose to run as a Democrat according to Franken himself?

options.text: Ann Coulter will never say she likes me again.
They care more about the poor than the Republicans
Paul Wellstone would have wanted me to do that.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They care more about the poor than the Republicans

questions.question: Hattie Durham becomes romantically involved with which character in Tribulation Force?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nicolae

questions.question: After leaving college in Oxford, T. S. Eliot took a teaching job at Highgate School. There he taught this future British Poet Laureate, documentarian of Metro-land, and self-described poet and hack.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir John Betjeman

questions.question: What is the name of the church that Rayford Steele, Chloe Steele, Buck Williams and Bruce Barnes are members of in the second novel in the Left Behind series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Hope Village Church

questions.question: Who is Al Franken talking about when he says, He had us all supporting him and united after 9/11 and then he created a war in Iraq and he will never really have Mission Accomplished?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George W. Bush

questions.question: Fictional characters Both Buck and Rayford go to work for Nicolae Carpathia in Tribulation Force.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who coined the name Tribulation Force for the group portrayed in the second book of the series Left Behind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chloe

questions.question: While a student at Harvard, T. S. Eliot befriended this Spanish-born philosopher, essayist, poet, and novelist who wrote in Reason in Common Sense, Those who cannot remember the past, are condemned to repeat it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Santayana

questions.question: In his book Lies and the Lying Liars Who Tell Them, Al Franken refers to this radio talk show host as a Big Fat Idiot.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rush Limbaugh

questions.question: In 1920, T. S. Eliot published the collection Poems. It included the poem Gerontion. What famous phrase, often used to describe espionage and counter-intelligence, comes from this poem?

options.text: three trees against a low sky

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: wilderness of mirrors

questions.question: In his book Lies and the Lying Liars Who Tell Them, Franken writes that these two words are Bill OReillys answer to any intelligent liberal comment.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: shut up

questions.question: What famous poem by T. S. Eliot was considered offensive and upsetting because of its opening lines describing the dusky sky as a patient etherised upon a table.?

options.text: The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock

questions.question: After marriage, T. S. Eliot gave up writing his dissertation, and never received his PhD.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Dick Francis and Tribulation Force
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, profession, left. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was Dick Franciss profession before he became a writer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jockey

questions.question: What was the popular rumor that circulated about Dick Franciss books?

options.text: He paid a ghostwriter to write them.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His wife wrote them.

questions.question: What stunning announcement does Hattie make near the end of Tribulation Force?

options.text: Her and Nicolae are getting married.
She is pregnant with Rayfords child.
She is pregnant with Nicolaes child.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She is pregnant with Nicolaes child.

questions.question: What was the first novel Dick Francis wrote?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dead Cert

questions.question: Sid Halley, the protagonist of several novels by Dick Francis, is disabled. What is the nature of his disability?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He has only one hand.

questions.question: How many non-fiction books did Dick Francis write in the 20th century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: two

questions.question: Only two Dick Francis characters appear as the protagonist of more than one book. Sid Halley is one of them. Who is the other?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kit Fielding

questions.question: What is the profession of Charles Todd in the novel In the Frame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Painter

questions.question: Both Rayford and his daughter Chloe are married in Tribulation Force
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The American Military moves against Nicolae in the book Tribulation Force
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Why didnt Dick Francis win the 1956 Grand National when he was a jump jockey for the Queen Mother?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His horse fell.

questions.question: Which member of the Tribulation Force dies at the end of the self-titled novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bruce

questions.question: In what novel by Dick Francis does the popular character Sid Halley first appear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Odds Against

questions.question: Nicolae Carpathia, the main antagonist in the Left Behind series, institutes a one-world religion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: One of the most interesting characters introduced in Tribulation Force is Rabinnacal Scholar Tsion (pronounced Zee-own) Ben-Judah, who made a startling announcement to the whole world that put him and his family in jeopardy. What was his announcement?

options.text: He believed Jesus was the promised Messiah.
He believed Nicolae was the Messiah promised in the Torrah.
He believed Nicolae was the Anti-Christ.
He believed Nicolae would unite the world into a glorious utopia.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He believed Jesus was the promised Messiah.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Book and Clique
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, committee, death. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who comes back with Alicia from Spain in Lisi Harrisons The Clique?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nina

questions.question: If you really want to hear about it, the first thing youll probably want to know is where I was born, and what my lousy childhood was like, and how my parents were occupied and all before they had me, and all that David Copperfield kind of crap, but I dont feel like going into it, if you want to know the truth.

options.text: ing one of the most controversial and widely disputed literary works of the 20th century, this novel by J. D. Salinger has been banned several times in the United States for inappropriate and immoral content.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Catcher in the Rye

questions.question: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times. is the beginning of this famous Dickens historical novel, concerning the French Revolution and dealing with some timeless moral issues, such as guilt, treachery and patriotism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Tale of Two Cities

questions.question: No one would have believed, in the last years of the nineteenth century, that human affairs were being watched keenly and closely by intelligences greater than mans and yet as mortal as his own; that as men busied themselves about their affairs they were scrutinized and studied, perhaps almost as narrowly as a man with a microscope might scrutinize the transient creatures that swarm and multiply in a drop of water.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The War of the Worlds

questions.question: It was a pleasure to burn.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fahrenheit 451

questions.question: There were four of us.

options.text: The Idle Thoughts of an Idle Fellow

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three Men in a Boat

questions.question: Call me Ishmael.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moby-Dick

questions.question: What movie does The Clique character Claire get a part in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dial L for Loser

questions.question: Who is the Pretty Committees second in command in the book The Clique?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dylan

questions.question: What did Dick Francis do after the death of his wife?

options.text: He began collaborating with his older son Merrick.
He began collaborating with his younger son Felix.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He began collaborating with his younger son Felix.

questions.question: It can hardly be a coincidence that no language on Earth has ever produced the expression as pretty as an airport.

options.text: is typical for author Douglas Adams, this 1988 detective novel begins with a humorous and unusual line, grabbing attention from the very first sentence.
The Long Dark Tea-Time of the Soul
The Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy
The Restaurant at the End of the Universe

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Long Dark Tea-Time of the Soul

questions.question: Kristen Gregory from the book The Clique is rich and always wears designer clothes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the novel The Clique, what school do the members of the Pretty Committee go to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: OCD

questions.question: The Clique protagonist Massie Block has a pet in the book.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The members of the Pretty Committee, described in the novel The Clique, get kicked out of school.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True
